snippet: A Chicago Bears quarterback known as Bull, John Doehring could fling the ball behind his back more than half the length of the field.
abstract: Box Seats article, adapted from a book by Dan Daly on professional football's first fifty years, notes that 1930s Chicago Bears quarterback John Doehring could fling the ball behind his back more than half the length of the field.
lead_paragraph: A Chicago Bears quarterback known as Bull, John Doehring could fling the ball behind his back more than half the length of the field.

headline.seo: In N.F.L.’s Early Days, John Doehring Was a Passing Sideshow in the Chicago Bears’ Circus Act
